intro: Pseudostellaria sylvatica var. retusa, commonly known as the hairy starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and stonecrops. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
